definition: Activities before drafting that generate and organize ideas, including brainstorming, outlining, research, and planning

positive_examples: Prewriting strategies: freewriting, clustering, listing, questioning, outlining.
Time spent in prewriting reduces revision time by clarifying structure early.
Research is part of prewriting: gathering material before drafting.
The outline organizes prewriting ideas into a preliminary structure.
negative_examples: The author thought about what to write.
training_hints.disambiguation: Specific ideation and organization activities before drafting, not just thinking
